text: heavy rains and wind hit tably see on
Saturday evening turning a normally
small stream that runs through the hilly
city into a surging River several people
have been killed by the torrents of
water and dozens of houses damaged one
of the most severely hit parts of the
city is the zoo three zoo workers have
died and it's thought that up to half of
the 600 animal residents may also have
perished authorities have advised
residents to stay indoors as numerous
animals have escaped their enclosures an
escaped hippopotamus seen wandering
through the streets was eventually
cornered in one of the city's main
squares and subdued with a tranquilizer
gun in front of a popular retail
shopping store helicopters continued to
circle the city looking for animals
while rescue workers keep searching
submerged houses to check for trapped
residents Sophia Tran Thomson BBC news
